section.name: Logistic regression
section.topText: Least squares is used to predict a numerical response from a numerical explanatory variable. When the response variable is categorical, the goal is to predict the proportion in each response category, and a different analysis is required.
section.page: With a categorical response and numerical explanatory variable, stacked bar charts at each X are an effective display.
Using a straight line to describe how the proportion in a category depends on X is not appropriate. A curve is required.
A 'logistic' curve can be used to model how a proportion depends on X.
A logistic curve is fitted to an example data set.
